name: Sixel Image
summary: Learn about .SIX files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: DEC created the Sixel format for use on terminals and printers released in the 1980s. For example, the VT200 and VT300 series terminals can display images saved in the Sixel format.

Each Sixel image, or SIX file, is comprised of binary data encoded into strings of six-bit numbers. Each number is then converted into an ASCII character. Programs that can read the Sixel format convert these ASCII character strings into raster images.

description: A SIX file is a raster image saved in the Sixel image format. It contains an image that was meant to be printed by a Digital Equipment Corporation (DEC) dot matrix printer or computer terminal. SIX files are comprised of "sixels," which are sets of six pixel columns.

instructions: You can open a SIX file with ImageMagick (multiplatform) or SixelViewer (Windows). You can also view the text a SIX file contains in any text editor.
You can use ImageMagick to convert SIX files to other image formats, including:
